intro: Epidendrum oroense, commonly known as the Orange-Flowered Epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its pendulous, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a reddish or violet tint. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. Epidendrum oroense is valued in horticulture for its vibrant blooms and relatively easy care requirements.
